meanings.definition: To set on fire or kindle
meanings.sent1: She emblazed the campfire with skillful hands.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters worked quickly to emblaze the forest before it spread.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally emblazed the dessert, creating a flaming spectacle.
meanings.sent4: His passionate speech emblazed the hearts of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The sunset emblazed the sky with vibrant hues.

meanings.definition: To adorn or decorate with bright colors or designs
meanings.sent1: The artist emblazed the canvas with bold strokes of color.
meanings.sent2: The garden was emblazed with flowers of every shade.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake was emblazed with glittering candles.
meanings.sent4: Her smile emblazed her face with joy.
meanings.sent5: The parade emblazed the streets with festive decorations.
